javax.servlet.sip.annotation.security

Annotation Type SipSecurity


  • @Inherited
@Documented
@Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface SipSecurity
    This annotation is used on a Servlet implementation class to specify security constraints to be enforced by the container on SIP protocol messages. The SIP servlet container will enforce these constraints on the annotated SIP servlet.
    Since:
    2.0

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      SipMethodConstraint[] sipMethodConstraints
      Get the SIP method specific constraints.
      SipConstraint value
      Get the SipConstraint that defines the protection that is to be applied to all SIP methods that are NOT represented in the array returned by sipMethodConstraints.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract SipConstraint value
        Get the SipConstraint that defines the protection that is to be applied to all SIP methods that are NOT represented in the array returned by sipMethodConstraints.
        Returns:
        a SipConstraint element.
        Default:
        @javax.servlet.sip.annotation.security.SipConstraint

      • sipMethodConstraints

        public abstract SipMethodConstraint[] sipMethodConstraints
        Get the SIP method specific constraints. Each SipMethodConstraint names an SIP protocol method and defines the protection to be applied to it.
        Returns:
        an array of SipMethodConstraint elements each defining the protection to be applied to one SIP protocol method. For any SIP method name, there must be at most one corresponding element in the returned array. If the returned array is of zero length, it indicates that no SIP method specific constraints are defined.
        Default:
        {}
